snippet: Excluding legal provisions and other one-time charges, Barclays’ full-year pretax profit rose 12 percent to $5.5 billion, exceeding analysts’ expectations.
abstract: Barclays reports annual net loss of 174 million pounds, or $268 million, down from a profit of 540 million pounds in 2013; results are dragged down by 2.8 billion pounds, or about $4.3 billion, in litigation and conduct charges, and decreased revenue as it shrinks its investment bank business.
lead_paragraph: Excluding legal provisions and other one-time charges, Barclays’ full-year pretax profit rose 12 percent to $5.5 billion, exceeding analysts’ expectations.

headline.main: Barclays Logs $268 Million 2014 Loss, After Charges for Potential Legal Costs
headline.print_headline: Barclays Logs $268 Million 2014 Loss, After Charges for Potential Legal Costs
